title: Trump threatens 200% tariffs on French wine and champagne after Macron refuses to join 'board of peace'
subhead: 'Tariff threats to influence our foreign policy are unacceptable and ineffective,' a source close to Macron said on Tuesday, after France said it intends to decline the US leader's invitation to join his 'board of peace' to rebuild Gaza.

title: In one year, Trump has imposed a culture of impunity
French PM breaks promise in order to strike budget deal with Socialists
These French billionaires want to be taxed, but don't say it publicly
subhead: The head of Oxfam France questioned billionaires about the 'Zucman tax,' a wealth tax on households worth more than €100 million. Not all were opposed, but none wanted to make their views public.

title: Chile wildfires rage for third day, entire towns wiped out
subhead: More than 3,500 firefighters were fighting the blazes on Monday in Nuble and Biobio, both declared disaster areas, allowing for the deployment of soldiers who patrolled a desolate landscape of melted cars, twisted metal and houses reduced to rubble.

title: Philharmonie de Paris director responds to protest at Israeli orchestra performance
subhead: On November 6, 2025, pro-Palestinian activists disrupted an Israel Philharmonic Orchestra concert three times. Olivier Mantei says he refused to equate artists with their government's policies.

title: In 'Hamnet,' love is haunted by the specter of death
subhead: Chloé Zhao's film, marked by its raw and singular poetry, follows the formation of William Shakespeare's household, capturing both its joys and tragedies.

title: On Réunion Island, thousands flock to witness volcano eruption

Europe signals readiness to hit back after Trump's tariff threat

Trial opens for man accused of killing French priest who sheltered him
Trump isolated after trade escalation with Europe over Greenland
subhead: The president's threats could undermine the agreement reached by the United States and the European Union in the summer of 2025.

title: Minneapolis emerges as new epicenter of resistance to Trump: 'ICE wasn't expecting that'
subhead: For several weeks, Minnesota's largest metropolitan area has been living under the strain of Operation Metro Surge, which saw the deployment of 2,000 Immigration and Customs Enforcement officers. Since the death of Renee Good on January 7, tensions with residents have reached a peak.

title: Yann Le Cun: 'Why I'm leaving Meta to launch my own AI start-up'
subhead: The former head of artificial intelligence research at Meta explains his decision to start a new company focused on the physical world, citing strategic differences with the American tech giant and predicting a 'third AI revolution' in the coming years.

title: The necessary showdown with Donald Trump
'In the face of Trump's imperialism, realism means defending the law as an indispensable tool'
'Corporate America is crushing the planet with its profits'
